*clap clap clap* Yâ€™ALL the long awaited [review?] post YOU HAVE BEEN WAITING FOR. or i sure hope so ğŸ¤­
-
the writing of this book was so lyrical, so beautifully woven together and the characters were so raw and vulnerably presented that i fell in love.

this book explored anxiety, depression, starvation, grief, forced marriage, emotional abuse, drugs and so many important elements altogether. 

i loved how VE Schwab presented addieâ€™s character, especially the aspect about the freedom addie yearned and how the only answer to that, living in a small village, was to be married. there were other aspects such as what it meanâ€™t/felt to walk in the streets at night as a women, addieâ€™s stubborn determination to keep on moving forward regardless of how life itself had turned against her, the back and forth time stamps!

i would have definitely enjoyed the book more if it was a tad more fast paced, the rhythm of the book is slow in my opinion, it was hard getting into it at first but once henry was introduced the book picked up and everything went HALLELUJAH OOOOOPâ€”

yâ€™all the emotions in this book definitely fluctuated, there were a lot of â€˜SERIOUSLY?â€™ - â€˜HOLY SHITâ€™ - â€˜OMG NO STOPâ€™ - â€˜LUC WTFâ€™ - â€˜EEEEE MY HEARTâ€™ - moments. you get the point.
-
also, ALSO, also, the art!! i fricking loved it. leaving a mark without actually trying. AHHHHHH

AND OMG DONâ€™T GET ME STARTED ON â€˜TIMEâ€™.

i related to henry so much in that aspect. his fear of time slipping away, going by too fast, not pausing, really made me relate because i think of time so much and how it is going by so fast. look we are already HALF WAY through the year?!
-
PLS the ending was low-key a shocker and MY HEARTTTTT. *wipes a tear* thatâ€™s all for today *sigh* hope you enjoyed this, perhaps i made you buy the book, or not, either way, thanks for reading it up until now!
-

QOTD: Do you have any audiobook narrators that you love? ğŸ§

Can I just get back on my little audiobook soapbox for a minute? ğŸ—£

I just started my next read, â­ï¸The Invisible Life of Addie LaRueâ­ï¸ by V. E. Schwab, after it came highly recommended in a previous post.

Turns out this book is narrated by Julia Whelan, who narrated People We Meet On Vacation, which I read earlier this year! There is something so special about finding an audiobook narrator who you love.â™¥ï¸ It immediately felt like I a friend was telling me a story, and made me that much more excited to read it.

The final recommendations on my previous post:
House of Salt and Sorrows - 3
Addie LaRue - 8
Kingdom of the Wicked - 4
Midnight Library - 3

Donâ€™t worry, the remaining books are still on my TBR list!

The Invisible Life of Addie LaRue gave me hope and broke my heart and I don't have the courage to go through that emotional pain again. Thank you @veschwab ğŸ˜­â¤

I have no words. 
I CANNOT STOP CRYING
EVERYTHING HURTS

I feel like this book was written for me because the curse that Addie has is probably one of my greatest fears The writing was absolute perfection, so gorgeous. I have never written anything like it. I have never related to a book so much. 
I really adore Henryâ€™s character so hard.

And that ending made me want to actually kms. I was a mess. I want no NEED more. I can't believe this is a stand-alone. I need to know if Addie got her happy ever after. I definitely think this is one of the books that everyone needs to read at least once in their life. 

Also, this book reminds me so much of cardigan. Whenever I listen to it i think of this book now.ğŸ˜­

This week's Friday Favourite is The Invisible Life of Addie LaRue, written by V. E. Schwab, narrated by Julia Whelan and recommended by Claire T!

"This book was recommended to me and I loved it! It is a fantasy, love story, spanning 300 years and set across the world, about a girl called Addie who makes a deal for immortality and freedom, but in exchange she will never be remembered by anyone. I loved the imagery, the descriptions of hardship and loneliness experienced by Addie and her resilience and creativity in trying to find ways to make her mark in history. It's certainly not a story that I will forget."

The Invisible Life of Addie LaRue is available to stream and download form our website or the Libby app today :)

@veschwab @justjuliawhelan

#TheInvisibleLifeOfAddieLaRue #TheInvisibleLifeOfAddieLaRueBook #AddieLaRue #AddieLaRueBook #VESchwab #VESchwabBooks #JuliaWhelan #DisabilitySupport #AnxietySupport #FreeAudiobooks

â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸

#TheInvisibleLifeOdAddieLaRue you have had me in a chokehold, youâ€™ve had me in tears of hate and anger and frustration and joy, hope, love and pride and so much I donâ€™t have words for. Kept me up at night wondering, calculating, measuring where does the thin line between authentic, absolute truth and imagination, artistry blur, merge, connect, feed into each other. 

I will be coming back over and over, just to feel less alone, unseen and sometimes seen too much, too closely. To feel like someone gets it. The growing old, the withering away, losing time, losing self. For the constant tug of war between sufficient and scarce and always wanting more of something.

Without giving spoilers (because I want everyone to read it), every part of it, every year, every decade, every era.. all the three hundred years still somehow feel not enough. And i now sit here and wonder with the limited time and looming mortality what parts of life must be rushed through and what should be cherished. And which dreams must be expelled and mostly how do I bring the fuel to maximise on the tick tock. 
I have always felt there isnâ€™t enough time and somehow I think even an eternity wouldnâ€™t be enough.
.
.
.

âœ¨BOOK REVIEWâœ¨ 
Book Title: The Invisible Life of Addie LaRue
Author: V.E. Schwab
Rating: â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸/5
Review: SPOILER-FREE 
â €â €â €â €â €â €â €â €â €
â™¡ â€œBut if you only walk in other peopleâ€™s steps, you cannot make your own way. You cannot leave a mark.â€ 
â €â €â €â €â €â €â €â €â €
Well, this was my first book my V.E. Schwab, and holy HELL. I had taken a little break from fantasy before I got to this, which I will be posting the books I read in that time later, but I need a minute to freak over this book.
â €â €â €â €â €â €â €â €â €
Initially, Iâ€™d only seen this on booktok, bookstagram, so didnâ€™t know a huge deal about it apart from it looked stunning ğŸ˜‚ but I got started and oh my god, I am now forcing everyone to read this book. 
â €â €â €â €â €â €â €â €â €
Addie doesnâ€™t want to get married. Addie wants to be free. And this leads her to make very possibly the worst deal of her life. She will be free, but the cost is that no-one, NO-ONE, remembers who she is. Additionally, she has all the time in the world to experience her backwards freedom, as she has been granted immortality by a dark, twisted demon. Until one day, someone does remember her. For the first time in 300 years, there is a break in the loneliness.
â €â €â €â €â €â €â €â €â €
I donâ€™t even think that does it justice, but Iâ€™m trying not to give anything away, here, just trust me and read this, cause with magic, romance, mystery, and a sprinkling of history, this is just an ideal fantasy escape. V.E. Schwab is becoming an insta-buy author for me! â™¡
â €â €â €â €â €â €â €â €â €

I finally read this book & really enjoyed it! 

to addie: you are the most beautiful character. I loved her bravery, growth, & overall story. â€œBut there is no question she has livedâ€ ğŸ¥¹

I loved that this book was set a lot in New York City. I also loved the other place settings in this book. this book was making me want to travel the world. ğŸ«¶ğŸ»

I wish I connected with this book like others have. I wanted so badly to have that feeling. it doesnâ€™t mean I wonâ€™t be recommending this book to others! I think you can love a book & also not connect with it in a way other people might have while reading it. 

the writing was BEAUTIFUL. lots of well written/relatable quotes in this book. (pictured a couple of my favorites) 

â€¼ï¸ trigger warnings in this book: death, starvation, war, drug & alcohol abuse, depression, manipulation, violence, grief. â€¼ï¸ 

I would also recommend this book if you are wanting to get into the fantasy genre!

my first library rental. ğŸ¥¹

well since I was a kid. growing up the library was one of my FAV places to go. As I got older & started buying my own books I stopped going to the library. 

since joining bookstagram & seeing all of the amazing libraries out there, I decided to get a library card! 

I think right now I want to utilize the library for books Iâ€™m hesitant to read! that way I donâ€™t feel bad for spending money on a book that will sit on my shelf till the end of time. ğŸ˜…

I had this book on hold & it was honestly so fun to find it on the shelf & scan it to take home! 

question: do you utilize your local library? ğŸ¤·ğŸ¼â€â™€ï¸ Iâ€™m sure all libraries are different but please tell me all there is to know about everything the library has to offer!

Wow. Okay this book was ğŸ¥²ğŸ’…ğŸ»ğŸ‘ğŸ»
â­ï¸ 5

This book took me through a roller coaster of emotions and I actually think I need a week off of reading to mentally collect myselfğŸ¥²

It follows this girl Addie who was born in the 1700s but made a deal with the devil to have more time and live longer, but he tricked her in the sense of whoever meets her forgets her, no one remembers who she is , until she meets Henry. A boy who lives in New York City ( 300 years later). It follows their journey and how their lives intertwine and how they are a lot more alike than they think , buttttt the Devil doesnâ€™t play fair and of course he gets involved and itâ€™s becomes absolute madness ğŸ«£ This book honestly broke me and we donâ€™t need to talk about it again - thank you for coming to my Ted talk.
